alert.note: Alert for Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball; Morrill (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 30 at 7:09PM CDT until May 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Cheyenne County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Kimball County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Southwestern Morrill County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Banner County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... * Until 700 PM MDT. * At 608 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Chimney Rock State Park to 6 miles north of Pine Bluffs, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated and surface observations. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Redington around 630 PM MDT. Oliver Campground and Oliver Reservoir around 635 PM MDT. Kimball and Kimball Airport around 650 PM MDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Bushnell. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 2 and 36. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows.
